017package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.rgb;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.Gdx;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.*;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.TextureRegion;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram;
024import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Affine2;
025import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
026import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Matrix4;
027import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.NumberUtils;
028
029import java.nio.Buffer;
030
031/**
032 * A substitute for {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.SpriteBatch} that adds another attribute to store an
033 * extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the RGB channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak")
034 * while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from {@link Palette} or
035 * generated with {@link ColorTools}). This ColorfulBatch uses the RGB color space, like SpriteBatch, but the batch
036 * color here is additive for the red, green, and blue channels, while the tweak is multiplicative, and the neutral
037 * value for all RGB channels is 0.5 (instead of 1.0 for SpriteBatch). Additive values cause no change when they are
038 * 0.5, but cause a sharp increase at 1.0 and a sharp decrease at 0.0. In the tweak, r maps to multiplicative red,
039 * g maps to multiplicative green, b maps to multiplicative blue, and a maps to "exponential-like" contrast. Like with
040 * the additive values, 0.5 causes no change for multiplicative values, but you can think of the existing color as being
041 * temporarily shifted down by 0.5 for each of the RGB channels, so each RGB channel's range is -0.5 to 0.5 before being
042 * multiplied by the corresponding tweak value (times 2.0, which means multiplicative tweak values less than 0.5 make
043 * colors darker and values greater than 0.5 make colors lighter) and then shifted back to its prior range. Contrast is
044 * a special value; 0.5 still means "no change," but lower values will make lightness changes less distinct between
045 * similar colors, while higher values will "sharpen" the changes in lightness.
046 * <br>
047 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 12/14/2019.
048 */
049public class ColorfulBatch implements Batch {
050    /**
051     * How many floats are used for one "sprite" (meaning a TextureRegion).
052     */
053    public static final int SPRITE_SIZE = 24;
054    /**
055     * The name of the attribute used for the tweak color in GLSL shaders.
056     */
057    public static final String TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE = "a_tweak";
058
059    /**
060     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
061     */
062    protected Mesh mesh;
063
064    /**
065     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
066     */
067    protected float[] vertices;
068    /**
069     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
070     */
071    protected int idx = 0;
072    /**
073     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
074     */
075    protected Texture lastTexture = null;
076    /**
077     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
078     */
079    protected float invTexWidth = 0;
080    /**
081     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
082     */
083    protected float invTexHeight = 0;
084
085    /**
086     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
087     */
088    protected boolean drawing = false;
089
090    /**
091     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
092     */
093    protected final Matrix4 transformMatrix = new Matrix4();
094    /**
095     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
096     */
097    protected final Matrix4 projectionMatrix = new Matrix4();
098    /**
099     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
100     */
101    protected final Matrix4 combinedMatrix = new Matrix4();
102
103    /**
104     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
105     */
106    protected boolean blendingDisabled = false;
107    /**
108     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
109     */
110    protected int blendSrcFunc = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
111    /**
112     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
113     */
114    protected int blendDstFunc = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
115    /**
116     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
117     */
118    protected int blendSrcFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_SRC_ALPHA;
119    /**
120     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
121     */
122    protected int blendDstFuncAlpha = GL20.GL_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA;
123
124    /**
125     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
126     */
127    protected ShaderProgram shader;
128    /**
129     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
130     */
131    protected ShaderProgram customShader = null;
132    /**
133     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
134     */
135    protected boolean ownsShader;
136
137    /**
138     * A packed float color added to the base color of a drawn pixel (which is typically from a Texture) after the tweak
139     * has been multiplied with that base color.
140     */
141    protected float color = Palette.GRAY;
142    /**
143     * Internal; not intended for external usage and undocumented.
144     */
145    protected final Color tempColor = new Color(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 1f);
146
147    /**
148     * A constant packed float that can be assigned to this ColorfulBatch's tweak with {@link #setTweak(float)} to make
149     * all the tweak adjustments virtually imperceptible. When this is set as the tweak, it won't change the
150     * lightness multiplier or lightness contrast, and it won't change either chromatic value multiplier.
151     */
152    public static final float TWEAK_RESET = ColorTools.rgb(0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f);
153    /**
154     * A packed float color multiplied with 2.0 and the base color of a drawn pixel (which is typically from a Texture).
155     * This can be created with {@link ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)} like any other packed float color,
156     * but the rgba channels instead refer to multiplicative r, g, and b, and contrast, with 0.5 having nearly no change
157     * and 0.0 or 1.0 having extreme changes.
158     */
159    protected float tweak = TWEAK_RESET;
160
161    /**
162     * Number of render calls since the last {@link #begin()}.
163     **/
164    public int renderCalls = 0;
165
166    /**
167     * Number of rendering calls, ever. Will not be reset unless set manually.
168     **/
169    public int totalRenderCalls = 0;
170
171    /**
172     * The maximum number of sprites rendered in one batch so far.
173     **/
174    public int maxSpritesInBatch = 0;
175
176    /**
177     * Constructs a new ColorfulBatch with a size of 1000, one buffer, and the default shader.
178     *
179     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)
180     */
181    public ColorfulBatch() {
182        this(1000, null);
183    }
184
185    /**
186     * Constructs a ColorfulBatch with one buffer and the default shader.
187     *
188     * @see #ColorfulBatch(int, ShaderProgram)
189     */
190    public ColorfulBatch(int size) {
191        this(size, null);
192    }
193
194    /**
195     * Constructs a new ColorfulBatch. Sets the projection matrix to an orthographic projection with y-axis point upwards, x-axis
196     * point to the right and the origin being in the bottom left corner of the screen. The projection will be pixel perfect with
197     * respect to the current screen resolution.
198     * <p>
199     * The defaultShader specifies the shader to use. Note that the names for uniforms for this default shader are different than
200     * the ones expect for shaders set with {@link #setShader(ShaderProgram)}. See {@link #createDefaultShader()}.
201     *
202     * @param size          The max number of sprites in a single batch. Max of 16383.
203     * @param defaultShader The default shader to use. This is not owned by the ColorfulBatch and must be disposed separately.
204     */
205    public ColorfulBatch(int size, ShaderProgram defaultShader) {
206        // 65535 is max vertex index, so 65535 / 4 vertices per sprite = 16383 sprites max.
207        if (size > 16383) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Can't have more than 16383 sprites per batch: " + size);
208
209        Mesh.VertexDataType vertexDataType = (Gdx.gl30 != null) ? Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexBufferObjectWithVAO : Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray;
210
211        mesh = new Mesh(vertexDataType, false, size * 4, size * 6,
212                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.Position, 2, ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE),
213                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE),
214                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.TextureCoordinates, 2, ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0"),
215                new VertexAttribute(VertexAttributes.Usage.ColorPacked, 4, TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE));
216
217        projectionMatrix.setToOrtho2D(0, 0, Gdx.graphics.getWidth(), Gdx.graphics.getHeight());
218
219        vertices = new float[size * SPRITE_SIZE];
220
221        int len = size * 6;
222        short[] indices = new short[len];
223        short j = 0;
224        for (int i = 0; i < len; i += 6, j += 4) {
225            indices[i] = j;
226            indices[i + 1] = (short) (j + 1);
227            indices[i + 2] = (short) (j + 2);
228            indices[i + 3] = (short) (j + 2);
229            indices[i + 4] = (short) (j + 3);
230            indices[i + 5] = j;
231        }
232        mesh.setIndices(indices);
233
234        if (defaultShader == null) {
235            shader = createDefaultShader();
236            ownsShader = true;
237        } else
238            shader = defaultShader;
239
240        // Pre bind the mesh to force the upload of indices data.
241        if (vertexDataType != Mesh.VertexDataType.VertexArray) {
242            mesh.bind(shader);
243            mesh.unbind(shader);
244        }
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Makes a new instance of the default ShaderProgram used for this ColorfulBatch, without any {@code #version}
249     * specified in the shader source. This expects an extra attribute (relative to a normal SpriteBatch) that is used
250     * for the tweak. You may want to set the code to prepend before you call this, as with:
251     * {@code ShaderProgram.prependVertexCode = "#version 110\n";
252     * ShaderProgram.prependFragmentCode = "#version 110\n";}
253     * The actual version can be different, and may need to be different for compatibility with some hardware.
254     *
255     * @return a new instance of the default shader used by ColorfulBatch for GL2 when no shader is specified
256     */
257    public static ShaderProgram createDefaultShader() {
258        String vertexShader = "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
259                + "attribute vec4 " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
260                + "attribute vec2 " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
261                + "attribute vec4 " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
262                + "uniform mat4 u_projTrans;\n"
263                + "varying vec4 v_color;\n"
264                + "varying vec4 v_tweak;\n"
265                + "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n"
266                + "\n"
267                + "void main()\n"
268                + "{\n"
269                + "   v_color = " + ShaderProgram.COLOR_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
270                + "   v_color.rgb = v_color.rgb - 0.5;\n"
271//                + "   v_color.rgb = v_color.rgb * 0.5 - 0.25;\n"
272                + "   v_color.a = v_color.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
273                + "   v_tweak = " + TWEAK_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
274                + "   v_tweak.a = v_tweak.a * (255.0/254.0);\n"
275                + "   v_texCoords = " + ShaderProgram.TEXCOORD_ATTRIBUTE + "0;\n"
276                + "   gl_Position =  u_projTrans * " + ShaderProgram.POSITION_ATTRIBUTE + ";\n"
277                + "}\n";
278        String fragmentShader =
279                "#ifdef GL_ES\n" +
280                        "#define LOWP lowp\n" +
281                        "precision mediump float;\n" +
282                        "#else\n" +
283                        "#define LOWP \n" +
284                        "#endif\n" +
285                        "varying vec2 v_texCoords;\n" +
286                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_color;\n" +
287                        "varying LOWP vec4 v_tweak;\n" +
288                        "uniform sampler2D u_texture;\n" +
289                        "vec3 barronSpline(vec3 x, float shape) {\n" +
290                        "        const float turning = 0.5;\n" +
291                        "        vec3 d = turning - x;\n" +
292                        "        return mix(\n" +
293                        "          ((1. - turning) * (x - 1.)) / (1. - (x + shape * d)) + 1.,\n" +
294                        "          (turning * x) / (1.0e-20 + (x + shape * d)),\n" +
295                        "          step(0.0, d));\n" +
296                        "}\n" +
297                        "void main()\n" +
298                        "{\n" +
299                        "  vec4 tgt = texture2D( u_texture, v_texCoords );\n" +
300                        "  tgt.rgb = barronSpline(clamp(tgt.rgb * v_tweak.rgb * 2.0 + v_color.rgb, 0.0, 1.0), v_tweak.a * 1.5 + 0.25);\n" +
301                        "  tgt.a *= v_color.a;\n" +
302                        "  gl_FragColor = tgt;\n" +
303                        "}";
304        ShaderProgram shader = new ShaderProgram(vertexShader, fragmentShader);
305        if (!shader.isCompiled()) throw new IllegalArgumentException("Error compiling shader: " + shader.getLog());
306        return shader;
307    }
308
309    @Override
310    public void begin() {
311        if (drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.end must be called before begin.");
312        renderCalls = 0;
313
314        Gdx.gl.glDepthMask(false);
315        if (customShader != null)
316            customShader.bind();
317        else
318            shader.bind();
319        setupMatrices();
320
321        drawing = true;
322    }
323
324    @Override
325    public void end() {
326        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before end.");
327        if (idx > 0) flush();
328        lastTexture = null;
329        drawing = false;
330
331        GL20 gl = Gdx.gl;
332        gl.glDepthMask(true);
333        if (isBlendingEnabled()) gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
334    }
335
336    @Override
337    public void setColor(Color tint) {
338        color = tint.toFloatBits();
339    }
340
341    /**
342     * Sets the color to the result of {@link ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)} on the same arguments.
343     * For the RGB parameters, 0.5f is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 1.0f is a neutral
344     * value. For RGB, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
345     *
346     * @param red   additive red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
347     * @param green additive green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
348     * @param blue  additive blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
349     * @param alpha multiplicative opacity, from 0 to 1; 1.0 is neutral
350     * @see ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)
351     */
352    @Override
353    public void setColor(float red, float green, float blue, float alpha) {
354        color = ColorTools.rgb(red, green, blue, alpha);
355    }
356
357    public void setColor(final float color) {
358        setPackedColor(color);
359    }
360
361    /**
362     * Expects an int color in the format (red, 8 bits), (green, 8 bits), (blue, 8 bits), (alpha, 7 bits),
363     * (ignored, 1 bit).
364     * @param color an int color with alpha in the least significant byte and red in the most significant
365     */
366    public void setIntColor(final int color) {
367        this.color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(color & -2));
368    }
369
370    /**
371     * Sets the color with the given RGB and A parameters from 0 to 255.
372     * For the RGB parameters, 127 is a neutral value (causing no change), while for alpha, 255 is a neutral
373     * value. For RGB, higher values will add to the corresponding channel, while lower values will subtract from it.
374     *
375     * @param red   additive red channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
376     * @param green additive green channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
377     * @param blue  additive blue channel; ranges from 0 to 255, and 127 is neutral
378     * @param alpha multiplicative opacity; ranges from 0 to 255 (254 is equivalent, since the lowest bit is discarded)
379     * @see ColorTools#rgb(float, float, float, float)
380     */
381    public void setIntColor(int red, int green, int blue, int alpha) {
382        color = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((alpha << 24 & 0xFE000000)
383                | (blue << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (green << 8 & 0xFF00) | (red & 0xFF));
384    }
385
386    @Override
387    public void setPackedColor(final float color) {
388        this.color = color;
389    }
390
391    @Override
392    public Color getColor() {
393        final int intBits = NumberUtils.floatToRawIntBits(color);
394        Color color = tempColor;
395        color.r = (intBits & 0xff) / 255f;
396        color.g = ((intBits >>> 8) & 0xff) / 255f;
397        color.b = ((intBits >>> 16) & 0xff) / 255f;
398        color.a = (intBits >>> 25) / 127f;
399        return color;
400    }
401
402    @Override
403    public float getPackedColor() {
404        return color;
405    }
406
407    /**
408     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 0.5 is a neutral value that should have
409     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f, 0.5f)} will effectively remove the tweak. You can
410     * also use {@link #setTweak(float)} with {@link #TWEAK_RESET}, which is very slightly more efficient, to remove the
411     * tweak or set it to a neutral value.
412     *
413     * @param red      multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
414     * @param green    multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
415     * @param blue     multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
416     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look); 0.5 is neutral
417     */
418    public void setTweak(float red, float green, float blue, float contrast) {
419        tweak = ColorTools.rgb(red, green, blue, contrast);
420    }
421
422    /**
423     * Sets the tweak using a single packed RGB float.
424     *
425     * @param tweak a packed RGB float, with contrast instead of alpha
426     * @see #setTweak(float, float, float, float)
427     */
428    public void setTweak(final float tweak) {
429        this.tweak = tweak;
430    }
431
432    public float getTweak() {
433        return tweak;
434    }
435
436    /**
437     * Takes the tweak as an int in the format: red (8 bits), green (8 bits), blue (8 bits), contrast (7 bits),
438     * (1 ignored bit at the end). An example would be 0xC820206E, which significantly emphasizes red (with red 0xC8,
439     * a little over 3/4 of the max and higher than the neutral value of 0x80), significantly reduces green and blue
440     * effect with green and blue multipliers of 0x20 (closer to 0, so most green and blue in the final color, if any,
441     * will come from the additive color), and slightly reduces contrast (with contrast and the ignored bit as 0x6E,
442     * which is less than the halfway point).
443     *
444     * @param tweak the tweak to use as an integer, with red in the most significant bits and contrast in least
445     */
446    public void setIntTweak(final int tweak) {
447        this.tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat(Integer.reverseBytes(tweak & -2));
448    }
449
450    /**
451     * Sets the multiplicative and contrast parts of the shader's color changes. 127 is a neutral value that should have
452     * minimal effect on the image; using {@code (127, 127, 127, 127)} will effectively remove the tweak.
453     *
454     * @param red      multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
455     * @param green    multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
456     * @param blue     multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 255; 127 is neutral
457     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 255 (high contrast, sharpened look); 127 is neutral
458     */
459    public void setIntTweak(int red, int green, int blue, int contrast) {
460        tweak = NumberUtils.intBitsToFloat((contrast << 24 & 0xFE000000)
461                | (blue << 16 & 0xFF0000) | (green << 8 & 0xFF00) | (red & 0xFF));
462    }
463
464    /**
465     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float)}) and the tweak (with
466     * {@link #setTweak(float)}) at the same time.
467     *
468     * @param color the additive components and alpha, as a packed float
469     * @param tweak the multiplicative components and contrast, as a packed float
470     */
471    public void setTweakedColor(final float color, final float tweak) {
472        setColor(color);
473        setTweak(tweak);
474    }
475
476    /**
477     * A convenience method that sets both the color (with {@link #setColor(float, float, float, float)}) and the tweak
478     * (with {@link #setTweak(float, float, float, float)}) at the same time.
479     *
480     * @param redAdd   additive red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
481     * @param greenAdd additive green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
482     * @param blueAdd  additive blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
483     * @param alphaMul multiplicative alpha channel, from 0 to 1; 1.0 is neutral
484     * @param redMul   multiplicative red channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
485     * @param greenMul multiplicative green channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
486     * @param blueMul  multiplicative blue channel, from 0 to 1; 0.5 is neutral
487     * @param contrast affects how lightness changes, from 0 (low contrast, cloudy look) to 1 (high contrast, sharpened look); 0.5 is neutral
488     */
489    public void setTweakedColor(final float redAdd, final float greenAdd,
490                                final float blueAdd, final float alphaMul,
491                                final float redMul, final float greenMul,
492                                final float blueMul, final float contrast) {
493        setColor(redAdd, greenAdd, blueAdd, alphaMul);
494        setTweak(redMul, greenMul, blueMul, contrast);
495    }
496
497
498    @Override
499    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height, float scaleX,
500                     float scaleY, float rotation, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
501        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
502
503        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
504
505        if (texture != lastTexture)
506            switchTexture(texture);
507        else if (idx == vertices.length)
508            flush();
509
510        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
511        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
512        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
513        float fx = -originX;
514        float fy = -originY;
515        float fx2 = width - originX;
516        float fy2 = height - originY;
517
518        // scale
519        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
520            fx *= scaleX;
521            fy *= scaleY;
522            fx2 *= scaleX;
523            fy2 *= scaleY;
524        }
525
526        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
527        final float p1x = fx;
528        final float p1y = fy;
529        final float p2x = fx;
530        final float p2y = fy2;
531        final float p3x = fx2;
532        final float p3y = fy2;
533        final float p4x = fx2;
534        final float p4y = fy;
535
536        float x1;
537        float y1;
538        float x2;
539        float y2;
540        float x3;
541        float y3;
542        float x4;
543        float y4;
544
545        // rotate
546        if (rotation != 0) {
547            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
548            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
549
550            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
551            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
552
553            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
554            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
555
556            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
557            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
558
559            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
560            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
561        } else {
562            x1 = p1x;
563            y1 = p1y;
564
565            x2 = p2x;
566            y2 = p2y;
567
568            x3 = p3x;
569            y3 = p3y;
570
571            x4 = p4x;
572            y4 = p4y;
573        }
574
575        x1 += worldOriginX;
576        y1 += worldOriginY;
577        x2 += worldOriginX;
578        y2 += worldOriginY;
579        x3 += worldOriginX;
580        y3 += worldOriginY;
581        x4 += worldOriginX;
582        y4 += worldOriginY;
583
584        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
585        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
586        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
587        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
588
589        if (flipX) {
590            float tmp = u;
591            u = u2;
592            u2 = tmp;
593        }
594
595        if (flipY) {
596            float tmp = v;
597            v = v2;
598            v2 = tmp;
599        }
600
601        final float color = this.color;
602        final float tweak = this.tweak;
603        final int idx = this.idx;
604        vertices[idx] = x1;
605        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
606        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
607        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
608        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
609        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
610
611        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
612        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
613        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
614        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
615        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
616        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
617
618        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
619        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
620        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
621        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
622        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
623        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
624
625        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
626        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
627        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
628        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
629        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
630        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
631        this.idx = idx + 24;
632    }
633
634    @Override
635    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth,
636                     int srcHeight, boolean flipX, boolean flipY) {
637        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
638
639        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
640
641        if (texture != lastTexture)
642            switchTexture(texture);
643        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
644            flush();
645
646        float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
647        float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
648        float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
649        float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
650        final float fx2 = x + width;
651        final float fy2 = y + height;
652
653        if (flipX) {
654            float tmp = u;
655            u = u2;
656            u2 = tmp;
657        }
658
659        if (flipY) {
660            float tmp = v;
661            v = v2;
662            v2 = tmp;
663        }
664
665        final float color = this.color;
666        final float tweak = this.tweak;
667        final int idx = this.idx;
668        vertices[idx] = x;
669        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
670        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
671        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
672        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
673        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
674
675        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
676        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
677        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
678        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
679        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
680        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
681
682        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
683        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
684        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
685        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
686        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
687        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
688
689        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
690        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
691        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
692        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
693        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
694        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
695        this.idx = idx + 24;
696    }
697
698    @Override
699    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, int srcX, int srcY, int srcWidth, int srcHeight) {
700        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
701
702        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
703
704        if (texture != lastTexture)
705            switchTexture(texture);
706        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
707            flush();
708
709        final float u = srcX * invTexWidth;
710        final float v = (srcY + srcHeight) * invTexHeight;
711        final float u2 = (srcX + srcWidth) * invTexWidth;
712        final float v2 = srcY * invTexHeight;
713        final float fx2 = x + srcWidth;
714        final float fy2 = y + srcHeight;
715
716        final float color = this.color;
717        final float tweak = this.tweak;
718        final int idx = this.idx;

736        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
737        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;

757        else if (idx == vertices.length) //

764        final float tweak = this.tweak;

800
801    @Override
802    public void draw(Texture texture, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
803        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
804
805        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
806
807        if (texture != lastTexture)
808            switchTexture(texture);
809        else if (idx == vertices.length) //
810            flush();
811
812        final float fx2 = x + width;
813        final float fy2 = y + height;
814        final float u = 0;
815        final float v = 1;
816        final float u2 = 1;
817        final float v2 = 0;
818
819        final float color = this.color;
820        final float tweak = this.tweak;
821        final int idx = this.idx;
822        vertices[idx] = x;
823        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
824        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
825        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
826        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
827        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
828
829        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
830        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
831        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
832        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
833        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
834        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
835
836        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
837        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
838        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
839        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
840        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
841        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
842
843        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
844        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
845        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
846        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
847        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
848        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
849        this.idx = idx + 24;
850    }
851
852    /**
853     * This is very different from the other overloads in this class; it assumes the float array it is given is in the
854     * format libGDX uses to give to SpriteBatch, that is, in groups of 20 floats per sprite. ColorfulBatch uses 24
855     * floats per sprite, to add tweak per color, so this does some conversion.
856     *
857     * @param texture        the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
858     * @param spriteVertices not the same format as {@link #vertices} in this class; should have a length that's a multiple of 20
859     * @param offset         where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
860     * @param count          how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (20 vertices is one sprite)
861     */
862    @Override
863    public void draw(Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
864        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
865
866        count = (count / 5) * 6;
867        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
868        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
869        if (texture != lastTexture)
870            switchTexture(texture);
871        else {
872            remainingVertices -= idx;
873            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
874                flush();
875                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
876            }
877        }
878        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
879        final float tweak = this.tweak;
880
881        ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
882        //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
883        ////new way, thanks mgsx
884        for (int s = offset, v = idx, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
885            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
886            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
887            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
888            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
889            vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
890            vertices[v++] = tweak;
891        }
892        idx += copyCount;
893        count -= copyCount;
894        while (count > 0) {
895            offset += (copyCount / 6) * 5;
896            flush();
897            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
898            ////old way, breaks when libGDX code expects SPRITE_SIZE to be 20
899            //System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
900            ////new way, thanks mgsx
901            for (int s = offset, v = 0, i = 0; i < copyCount; i += 6) {
902                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
903                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
904                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
905                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
906                vertices[v++] = spriteVertices[s++];
907                vertices[v++] = tweak;
908            }
909            idx += copyCount;
910            count -= copyCount;
911        }
912    }
913
914    /**
915     * Meant for code that uses ColorfulBatch specifically and can set an extra float (for the color tweak) per vertex,
916     * this is just like {@link #draw(Texture, float[], int, int)} when used in other Batch implementations, but expects
917     * {@code spriteVertices} to have a length that is a multiple of 24 instead of 20.
918     *
919     * @param texture        the Texture being drawn from; usually an atlas or some parent Texture with lots of TextureRegions
920     * @param spriteVertices vertices formatted as this class uses them; length should be a multiple of 24
921     * @param offset         where to start drawing vertices from {@code spriteVertices}
922     * @param count          how many vertices to draw from {@code spriteVertices} (24 vertices is one sprite)
923     */
924    public void drawExactly(Texture texture, float[] spriteVertices, int offset, int count) {
925        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
926
927        int verticesLength = vertices.length;
928        int remainingVertices = verticesLength;
929        if (texture != lastTexture)
930            switchTexture(texture);
931        else {
932            remainingVertices -= idx;
933            if (remainingVertices == 0) {
934                flush();
935                remainingVertices = verticesLength;
936            }
937        }
938        int copyCount = Math.min(remainingVertices, count);
939
940        System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, idx, copyCount);
941        idx += copyCount;
942        count -= copyCount;
943        while (count > 0) {
944            offset += copyCount;
945            flush();
946            copyCount = Math.min(verticesLength, count);
947            System.arraycopy(spriteVertices, offset, vertices, 0, copyCount);
948            idx += copyCount;
949            count -= copyCount;
950        }
951    }
952
953    @Override
954    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y) {
955        draw(region, x, y, region.getRegionWidth(), region.getRegionHeight());
956    }
957
958    @Override
959    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float width, float height) {
960        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
961
962        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
963
964        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
965        if (texture != lastTexture) {
966            switchTexture(texture);
967        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
968            flush();
969        }
970        final float fx2 = x + width;
971        final float fy2 = y + height;
972        final float u = region.getU();
973        final float v = region.getV2();
974        final float u2 = region.getU2();
975        final float v2 = region.getV();
976
977        final float color = this.color;
978        final float tweak = this.tweak;
979        final int idx = this.idx;
980        vertices[idx] = x;
981        vertices[idx + 1] = y;
982        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
983        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
984        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
985        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
986
987        vertices[idx + 6] = x;
988        vertices[idx + 7] = fy2;
989        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
990        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
991        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
992        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
993
994        vertices[idx + 12] = fx2;
995        vertices[idx + 13] = fy2;
996        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
997        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
998        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
999        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1000
1001        vertices[idx + 18] = fx2;
1002        vertices[idx + 19] = y;
1003        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1004        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1005        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1006        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1007        this.idx = idx + 24;
1008    }
1009
1010    @Override
1011    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1012                     float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation) {
1013        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1014
1015        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1016
1017        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1018        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1019            switchTexture(texture);
1020        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1021            flush();
1022
1023        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1024        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1025        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1026        float fx = -originX;
1027        float fy = -originY;
1028        float fx2 = width - originX;
1029        float fy2 = height - originY;
1030
1031        // scale
1032        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1033            fx *= scaleX;
1034            fy *= scaleY;
1035            fx2 *= scaleX;
1036            fy2 *= scaleY;
1037        }
1038
1039        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1040        final float p1x = fx;
1041        final float p1y = fy;
1042        final float p2x = fx;
1043        final float p2y = fy2;
1044        final float p3x = fx2;
1045        final float p3y = fy2;
1046        final float p4x = fx2;
1047        final float p4y = fy;
1048
1049        float x1;
1050        float y1;
1051        float x2;
1052        float y2;
1053        float x3;
1054        float y3;
1055        float x4;
1056        float y4;
1057
1058        // rotate
1059        if (rotation != 0) {
1060            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1061            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1062
1063            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1064            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1065
1066            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1067            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1068
1069            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1070            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1071
1072            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1073            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1074        } else {
1075            x1 = p1x;
1076            y1 = p1y;
1077
1078            x2 = p2x;
1079            y2 = p2y;
1080
1081            x3 = p3x;
1082            y3 = p3y;
1083
1084            x4 = p4x;
1085            y4 = p4y;
1086        }
1087
1088        x1 += worldOriginX;
1089        y1 += worldOriginY;
1090        x2 += worldOriginX;
1091        y2 += worldOriginY;
1092        x3 += worldOriginX;
1093        y3 += worldOriginY;
1094        x4 += worldOriginX;
1095        y4 += worldOriginY;
1096
1097        final float u = region.getU();
1098        final float v = region.getV2();
1099        final float u2 = region.getU2();
1100        final float v2 = region.getV();
1101
1102        final float color = this.color;
1103        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1104        final int idx = this.idx;
1105        vertices[idx] = x1;
1106        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1107        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1108        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1109        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1110        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1111
1112        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1113        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1114        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1115        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1116        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1117        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1118
1119        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1120        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1121        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1122        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1123        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1124        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1125
1126        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1127        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1128        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1129        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1130        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1131        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1132        this.idx = idx + 24;
1133    }
1134
1135    @Override
1136    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float x, float y, float originX, float originY, float width, float height,
1137                     float scaleX, float scaleY, float rotation, boolean clockwise) {
1138        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1139
1140        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1141
1142        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1143        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1144            switchTexture(texture);
1145        } else if (idx == vertices.length) //
1146            flush();
1147
1148        // bottom left and top right corner points relative to origin
1149        final float worldOriginX = x + originX;
1150        final float worldOriginY = y + originY;
1151        float fx = -originX;
1152        float fy = -originY;
1153        float fx2 = width - originX;
1154        float fy2 = height - originY;
1155
1156        // scale
1157        if (scaleX != 1 || scaleY != 1) {
1158            fx *= scaleX;
1159            fy *= scaleY;
1160            fx2 *= scaleX;
1161            fy2 *= scaleY;
1162        }
1163
1164        // construct corner points, start from top left and go counter clockwise
1165        final float p1x = fx;
1166        final float p1y = fy;
1167        final float p2x = fx;
1168        final float p2y = fy2;
1169        final float p3x = fx2;
1170        final float p3y = fy2;
1171        final float p4x = fx2;
1172        final float p4y = fy;
1173
1174        float x1;
1175        float y1;
1176        float x2;
1177        float y2;
1178        float x3;
1179        float y3;
1180        float x4;
1181        float y4;
1182
1183        // rotate
1184        if (rotation != 0) {
1185            final float cos = MathUtils.cosDeg(rotation);
1186            final float sin = MathUtils.sinDeg(rotation);
1187
1188            x1 = cos * p1x - sin * p1y;
1189            y1 = sin * p1x + cos * p1y;
1190
1191            x2 = cos * p2x - sin * p2y;
1192            y2 = sin * p2x + cos * p2y;
1193
1194            x3 = cos * p3x - sin * p3y;
1195            y3 = sin * p3x + cos * p3y;
1196
1197            x4 = x1 + (x3 - x2);
1198            y4 = y3 - (y2 - y1);
1199        } else {
1200            x1 = p1x;
1201            y1 = p1y;
1202
1203            x2 = p2x;
1204            y2 = p2y;
1205
1206            x3 = p3x;
1207            y3 = p3y;
1208
1209            x4 = p4x;
1210            y4 = p4y;
1211        }
1212
1213        x1 += worldOriginX;
1214        y1 += worldOriginY;
1215        x2 += worldOriginX;
1216        y2 += worldOriginY;
1217        x3 += worldOriginX;
1218        y3 += worldOriginY;
1219        x4 += worldOriginX;
1220        y4 += worldOriginY;
1221
1222        float u1, v1, u2, v2, u3, v3, u4, v4;
1223        if (clockwise) {
1224            u1 = region.getU2();
1225            v1 = region.getV2();
1226            u2 = region.getU();
1227            v2 = region.getV2();
1228            u3 = region.getU();
1229            v3 = region.getV();
1230            u4 = region.getU2();
1231            v4 = region.getV();
1232        } else {
1233            u1 = region.getU();
1234            v1 = region.getV();
1235            u2 = region.getU2();
1236            v2 = region.getV();
1237            u3 = region.getU2();
1238            v3 = region.getV2();
1239            u4 = region.getU();
1240            v4 = region.getV2();
1241        }
1242
1243        final float color = this.color;
1244        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1245        final int idx = this.idx;
1246        vertices[idx] = x1;
1247        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1248        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1249        vertices[idx + 3] = u1;
1250        vertices[idx + 4] = v1;
1251        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1252
1253        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1254        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1255        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1256        vertices[idx + 9] = u2;
1257        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1258        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1259
1260        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1261        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1262        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1263        vertices[idx + 15] = u3;
1264        vertices[idx + 16] = v3;
1265        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1266
1267        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1268        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1269        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1270        vertices[idx + 21] = u4;
1271        vertices[idx + 22] = v4;
1272        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1273        this.idx = idx + 24;
1274    }
1275
1276    @Override
1277    public void draw(TextureRegion region, float width, float height, Affine2 transform) {
1278        if (!drawing) throw new IllegalStateException("ColorfulBatch.begin must be called before draw.");
1279
1280        float[] vertices = this.vertices;
1281
1282        Texture texture = region.getTexture();
1283        if (texture != lastTexture) {
1284            switchTexture(texture);
1285        } else if (idx == vertices.length) {
1286            flush();
1287        }
1288
1289        // construct corner points
1290        float x1 = transform.m02;
1291        float y1 = transform.m12;
1292        float x2 = transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1293        float y2 = transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1294        float x3 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m01 * height + transform.m02;
1295        float y3 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m11 * height + transform.m12;
1296        float x4 = transform.m00 * width + transform.m02;
1297        float y4 = transform.m10 * width + transform.m12;
1298
1299        float u = region.getU();
1300        float v = region.getV2();
1301        float u2 = region.getV2();
1302        float v2 = region.getV();
1303
1304        final float color = this.color;
1305        final float tweak = this.tweak;
1306        final int idx = this.idx;
1307        vertices[idx] = x1;
1308        vertices[idx + 1] = y1;
1309        vertices[idx + 2] = color;
1310        vertices[idx + 3] = u;
1311        vertices[idx + 4] = v;
1312        vertices[idx + 5] = tweak;
1313
1314        vertices[idx + 6] = x2;
1315        vertices[idx + 7] = y2;
1316        vertices[idx + 8] = color;
1317        vertices[idx + 9] = u;
1318        vertices[idx + 10] = v2;
1319        vertices[idx + 11] = tweak;
1320
1321        vertices[idx + 12] = x3;
1322        vertices[idx + 13] = y3;
1323        vertices[idx + 14] = color;
1324        vertices[idx + 15] = u2;
1325        vertices[idx + 16] = v2;
1326        vertices[idx + 17] = tweak;
1327
1328        vertices[idx + 18] = x4;
1329        vertices[idx + 19] = y4;
1330        vertices[idx + 20] = color;
1331        vertices[idx + 21] = u2;
1332        vertices[idx + 22] = v;
1333        vertices[idx + 23] = tweak;
1334        this.idx = idx + 24;
1335    }
1336
1337    @SuppressWarnings("RedundantCast") // These casts are absolutely not redundant! Java 9 changed Buffer ABI.
1338    @Override
1339    public void flush() {
1340        if (idx == 0) return;
1341
1342        renderCalls++;
1343        totalRenderCalls++;
1344        int spritesInBatch = idx / SPRITE_SIZE;
1345        if (spritesInBatch > maxSpritesInBatch) maxSpritesInBatch = spritesInBatch;
1346        int count = spritesInBatch * 6;
1347
1348        lastTexture.bind();
1349        Mesh mesh = this.mesh;
1350        mesh.setVertices(vertices, 0, idx);
1351        Buffer indicesBuffer = (Buffer) mesh.getIndicesBuffer(true);
1352        indicesBuffer.position(0);
1353        indicesBuffer.limit(count);
1354        if (blendingDisabled) {
1355            Gdx.gl.glDisable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1356        } else {
1357            Gdx.gl.glEnable(GL20.GL_BLEND);
1358            if (blendSrcFunc != -1)
1359                Gdx.gl.glBlendFuncSeparate(blendSrcFunc, blendDstFunc, blendSrcFuncAlpha, blendDstFuncAlpha);
1360        }
1361
1362        mesh.render(customShader != null ? customShader : shader, GL20.GL_TRIANGLES, 0, count);
1363
1364        idx = 0;
1365    }
1366
1367    @Override
1368    public void disableBlending() {
1369        if (blendingDisabled) return;
1370        flush();
1371        blendingDisabled = true;
1372    }
1373
1374    @Override
1375    public void enableBlending() {
1376        if (!blendingDisabled) return;
1377        flush();
1378        blendingDisabled = false;
1379    }
1380
1381    @Override
1382    public void setBlendFunction(int srcFunc, int dstFunc) {
1383        setBlendFunctionSeparate(srcFunc, dstFunc, srcFunc, dstFunc);
1384    }
1385
1386    @Override
1387    public void setBlendFunctionSeparate(int srcFuncColor, int dstFuncColor, int srcFuncAlpha, int dstFuncAlpha) {
1388        if (blendSrcFunc == srcFuncColor && blendDstFunc == dstFuncColor && blendSrcFuncAlpha == srcFuncAlpha && blendDstFuncAlpha == dstFuncAlpha)
1389            return;
1390        flush();
1391        blendSrcFunc = srcFuncColor;
1392        blendDstFunc = dstFuncColor;
1393        blendSrcFuncAlpha = srcFuncAlpha;
1394        blendDstFuncAlpha = dstFuncAlpha;
1395    }
1396
1397    @Override
1398    public int getBlendSrcFunc() {
1399        return blendSrcFunc;
1400    }
1401
1402    @Override
1403    public int getBlendDstFunc() {
1404        return blendDstFunc;
1405    }
1406
1407    @Override
1408    public int getBlendSrcFuncAlpha() {
1409        return blendSrcFuncAlpha;
1410    }
1411
1412    @Override
1413    public int getBlendDstFuncAlpha() {
1414        return blendDstFuncAlpha;
1415    }
1416
1417    @Override
1418    public void dispose() {
1419        mesh.dispose();
1420        if (ownsShader && shader != null) shader.dispose();
1421    }
1422
1423    @Override
1424    public Matrix4 getProjectionMatrix() {
1425        return projectionMatrix;
1426    }
1427
1428    @Override
1429    public Matrix4 getTransformMatrix() {
1430        return transformMatrix;
1431    }
1432
1433    @Override
1434    public void setProjectionMatrix(Matrix4 projection) {
1435        if (drawing) flush();
1436        projectionMatrix.set(projection);
1437        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1438    }
1439
1440    @Override
1441    public void setTransformMatrix(Matrix4 transform) {
1442        if (drawing) flush();
1443        transformMatrix.set(transform);
1444        if (drawing) setupMatrices();
1445    }
1446
1447    protected void setupMatrices() {
1448        combinedMatrix.set(projectionMatrix).mul(transformMatrix);
1449        if (customShader != null) {
1450            customShader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1451            customShader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1452        } else {
1453            shader.setUniformMatrix("u_projTrans", combinedMatrix);
1454            shader.setUniformi("u_texture", 0);
1455        }
1456    }
1457
1458    protected void switchTexture(Texture texture) {
1459        flush();
1460        lastTexture = texture;
1461        invTexWidth = 1.0f / texture.getWidth();
1462        invTexHeight = 1.0f / texture.getHeight();
1463    }
1464
1465    @Override
1466    public void setShader(ShaderProgram shader) {
1467        if (shader == customShader) // avoid unnecessary flushing in case we are drawing
1468            return;
1469        if (drawing) {
1470            flush();
1471        }
1472        customShader = shader;
1473        if (drawing) {
1474            if (customShader != null)
1475                customShader.bind();
1476            else
1477                this.shader.bind();
1478            setupMatrices();
1479        }
1480    }
1481
1482    @Override
1483    public ShaderProgram getShader() {
1484        if (customShader == null) {
1485            return shader;
1486        }
1487        return customShader;
1488    }
1489
1490    @Override
1491    public boolean isBlendingEnabled() {
1492        return !blendingDisabled;
1493    }
1494
1495    public boolean isDrawing() {
1496        return drawing;
1497    }
1498
1499    public static final int X1 = 0;
1500    public static final int Y1 = 1;
1501    public static final int C1 = 2;
1502    public static final int U1 = 3;
1503    public static final int V1 = 4;
1504    public static final int T1 = 5;
1505    public static final int X2 = 6;
1506    public static final int Y2 = 7;
1507    public static final int C2 = 8;
1508    public static final int U2 = 9;
1509    public static final int V2 = 10;
1510    public static final int T2 = 11;
1511    public static final int X3 = 12;
1512    public static final int Y3 = 13;
1513    public static final int C3 = 14;
1514    public static final int U3 = 15;
1515    public static final int V3 = 16;
1516    public static final int T3 = 17;
1517    public static final int X4 = 18;
1518    public static final int Y4 = 19;
1519    public static final int C4 = 20;
1520    public static final int U4 = 21;
1521    public static final int V4 = 22;
1522    public static final int T4 = 23;
1523}
